equipments.name: Harvester
ratings: The harvester works perfectly and was in good condition when I received it
It can't harvest tubers yet stated as combined harvester

equipments.name: MouldBoard plough
equipments.description: suitable for cultivating land with no hard stones
ratings: My garden has light soil and the machine works perfectly

equipments.name: Planter
equipments.description: Best for planting all type of crops in a large scale farm.
reviews: Saved my normal labour cost, thanks

equipments.name: Disc plough
equipments.description: Suitable where there is hard stones and heavy soils. the disc can rollover the obstacles
reviews: Kindly consider offering discounts when renting for several days
your sales person was not polite

equipments.name: Rollers
equipments.description: suitable for dairy farming. used to pack hay and silage
reviews: I haven't tried it yet but looks good

equipments.name: AB:07
equipments.description: Whisky cask-aged imperial scotch ale. Beer perfect for when the rain is coming sideways. Liquorice, plum and raisin temper the warming alcohol, producing a beer capable of holding back the Scottish chill.
ratings: I like to drink this while watching TV
A beer like no other, best served hot

equipments.name: Bramling X
equipments.description: Good old Bramling Cross is elegant, refined, assured, (boring) and understated. Understated that is unless you hop the living daylights out of a beer with it. This is Bramling Cross re-invented and re-imagined, and shows just what can be done with English hops if you use enough of them. Poor Bramling Cross normally gets lost in a woeful stream of conformist brown ales made by sleepy cask ale brewers. But not anymore. This beer shows that British hops do have some soul, and is a fruity riot of blackberries, pears, and plums. Reminds me of the bramble, apple and ginger jam my grandmother used to make.

equipments.name: Misspent Youth
equipments.description: The brainchild of our small batch brewer, George Woods. A dangerously drinkable milk sugar- infused Scotch Ale.
ratings: Woe is me, how I long for the days of yore
Reminds me of that time I wasted all of my time
It's a flavor that makes you wonder: 'Who is the boss: Angela or Tony?'

equipments.name: Arcade Nation
equipments.description: Running the knife-edge between an India Pale Ale and a Stout, this particular style is one we truly love. Black IPAs are a great showcase for the skill of our brew team, balancing so many complex and twisting flavours in the same moment. The citrus, mango and pine from the hops – three of our all-time favourites – play off against the roasty dryness from the malt bill at each and every turn.

equipments.name: Movember
equipments.description: A deliciously robust, black malted beer with a decadent dark, dry cocoa flavour that provides an enticing backdrop to the Cascade hops.
reviews: Like autumn leaves readying themselves for the winter sun
Beep beep, you're having a beer
